critique: The document describes the establishment of a Council of Personnel Administration in the Federal Government. It aims to develop a more effective and economical system of employment and personnel management, and to promote the general welfare of the employees of the National Government. The order emphasizes coordination, standardization, and the application of best practices in personnel administration, both within the government and in comparison to private sector organizations. There is no discussion of immigration, executive power, or security vs. liberty. The document seems to promote a moderate level of government intervention in economic regulation through personnel management and standardization. It also seems to promote social inclusion through the promotion of general welfare of the employees.
